WRITING.TITLE: Alshon Jeffery not expected to be franchise-tagged by Bears, could we make a move for him?
WRITING.TEXT:
http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000787962/article/bears-not-expected-to-franchise-tag-alshon-jeffery?campaign=tw-nf-sf58938571-sf58938571 utm_source=t.co utm_medium=referral
Article basically says that the Bears aren't going to tag him and he'll be hitting the open market. Do you think our front office may be keeping an eye on him, and maybe that's why Jackson and Garon haven't been offered anything?
Yes this is a shitpost, but I think one of the reasons that Garon and Jackson haven't been offered anything are because of the other options that will be available. I think even though our defense is shit and needs improved the most, the focus will still probably be on the offense. Whether it's Jeffery or some other guy, I feel like at this point we're letting both walk and signing someone new. Jeffery would be a good addition if he can get his act together.
Devin Thomas, Fred Davis, Malcolm Kelly were our first three picks, oh god

Why do you think that? What has he shown in the past two years to suggest that he's first team quality? We should sell him while he's still worth something in my opinion. If he continues on this path his value will decline each year we hold onto him.

I see a lot of negativity about Mustafi, but remember how good he was up until around January. He didn't lose a game with us until January. It's not a coincidence, he's a good CB. He's been great in my eyes, bar the last month or so.
Xhaka has been alright I suppose. I expected more from him as a distributor. I was hoping he'd be able to play similarly to santi in that area of the game, but he hasn't created a whole lot. Still not sure how I feel about him.
Lucas has been good almost every time he's played. I think he needs to be in the first team. I think he could be something we need because he's much more direct than Iwobi is and I think he will contribute to the goals that have been lacking recently.
Holding seems like he has a bright future. I like how composed on the ball he is. His defensive work is decent, and I could see him becoming one of the better CB's in England eventually.
We'd need a running game and a good defense to win with either of those QB's, something we don't have and probably won't have next year. So no. We need to stick with Kirk.

I think we should sell one of Monreal or Gibbs and go for a top left back, like Jose Gaya, Ricardo Rodriguez, maybe even Alex Sandro.
I think we may already have the option in our team, but a good box to box midfielder would be key as well, but I want to see Ox in the role for a while to see if he might be what we're missing. From what I've seen of him there so far, he seems like a viable option. Partner him or Wilshere up with Xhaka and I think that could be a solid midfield.
We need someone who poses a scoring threat other than Alexis, which again I think we already have with the rotation of attackers we have. If one isn't playing well, then another steps in and is ready to play. We have the likes of Walcott, Iwobi, Welbeck, and Perez, who can all step in and put in a shift.
What we really need is a manager. Someone who has the winning mentality and can inspire the players to do the same. Look what Conte has done with Chelsea, we don't even need that drastic of a mentality change, we just need to get over the tipping point. I like Allegri considering that Juve is a very mentally strong team.
